intro: Hedyotis strigulosa, commonly known as the slender knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it has opposite, narrow leaves with a hairy texture. Hedyotis strigulosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
